title: Britax Frontier: Installation Using Vehicle Lap/Shoulder Belt; Long Path
description: Installing the Britax Frontier Harness-2-Booster car seat using the vehicle lap/shoulder belt and long belt path.  **Refer to your Frontier user guide for detailed instructions on which belt path to use when installing this car seat.**

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText: Installing the Britax Frontier Harness-2-Booster car seat using the vehicle lap/shoulder belt and long belt path.  **Refer to your Frontier user guide for detailed instructions on which belt path to use when installing this car seat.**

transcripts: If your vehicle has a tether anchor for the chosen seating position. Loosen the tether then remove the versa tether from the storage clip and place it up and over the child seat back. Next rotate the recline block to harness position. Now place the child seat on the vehicle seat. Pull the vehicle belt out. Route the lap portion of the belt over red lap belt guide while positioning the shoulder portion of the belt inside the child seat shell behind the head restraint. Do not route the shoulder portion of the vehicle seat belt through the red shoulder belt guide on the head restraint. Now rejoin the lap and shoulder belt portions of the vehicle belt. Route the belt through the slot to the back of the child seat. Across the back of the child seat shell then through the second belt slot to the front of the child seat. Next route the vehicle belt over the red belt guide around to the outside of the child seat. Verify that the vehicle belt is not twisted and then buckle it. Push the child seat firmly into the vehicle seat while removing all slack from the lap portion then from the shoulder portion vehicle belt. Verify that the child seat is secured. The child seat is secures when it cannot be moved front to back or side to side more than an inch at the belt path. If you don't achieve a proper installation re-install the seat, try an alternate installation method and/or alternate seating location.
